newsitem.title: USA: Blue chips fall on profit-taking, weak tobacco shares.
newsitem.headline: Blue chips fall on profit-taking, weak tobacco shares.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks fell Wednesday as investors called time out after a three-session winning streak and tobacco shares plunged as a crucial cigarette liability trial neared an end.
Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average closed down 31.44 points at 5,689.82.
In the broader market, declining issues led advances 12-10 on moderate volume of 349 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
